intro: Dianthus barbatus var. asiaticus, commonly known as the Asiatic poppy, is a flowering plant characterized by its showy, showy, cup-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors including red, pink, and white. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is native to regions of Asia, including China and the Himalayas. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a striking visual display that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
